definition: to be afraid/to fear/to dread/to be unable to endure/perhaps

sentences.english: Fear not therefore: ye are of more value than many sparrows.
sentences.chinese: 不要懼怕，你們比許多麻雀還貴重。

sentences.english: UK entrepreneurs do not seem to fear innovation.
sentences.chinese: 英國創業者似乎不懼怕創舊。

sentences.english: But another is the fact that Paul fears for the lost.
sentences.chinese: 但另一方面則是保羅爲失落的人而感到懼怕。

sentences.english: The most feared punishment is the defamation lawsuit which can result in permanent financial ruin.
sentences.chinese: 最令人懼怕的是會造成永久破財的毀謗官司。

sentences.english: The wise person does not deprecate life nor does he fear the cessation of life.
sentences.chinese: 智者既不會藐視生命，也不會懼怕死亡。

sentences.english: In this life-or-death climax , he showed himself a terrible personality.
sentences.chinese: 在這個生死關頭，他表現出一種令人懼怕的性格。

sentences.english: Be strong and courageous. Do not be afraid or discouraged.
sentences.chinese: 你當剛強壯膽，不要懼怕，也不要驚惶。

sentences.english: Of punitive police, political or moral, I have a wholesome horror.
sentences.chinese: 政治或道德的處罰政策，我有此一種有益的懼怕。

sentences.english: His heart is established, he shall not be afraid, until he see his desire upon his enemies.
sentences.chinese: 他的心堅決，毫不懼怕，直到他看見他的敵人遭報。
周圍遭患難，外有爭戰，內有懼怕。

sentences.english: For fear has to do with punishment, and whoever fears has not reached perfection in love.
sentences.chinese: 因爲懼怕裏含着刑罰，懼怕的人在愛裏未得完全。

sentences.english: For fear has to do with punishment, and whoever fears has not reached perfection in love.
sentences.chinese: 因爲懼怕裏含着刑罰，懼怕的人在愛裏未得完全。

sentences.english: The naked branches seemed to shiver with horror of the cold.
sentences.chinese: 光禿禿的枝條抖動着，彷彿它們也懼怕嚴寒。

sentences.english: Cynics suggested he was afraid of his own people as well.
sentences.chinese: 犬儒派稱他同樣懼怕自己的人民。

sentences.english: You always fill my heart with songs of deliverance. WheneverI am afraid.
sentences.chinese: 你必以得救的樂歌四面環繞我，每當我心懼怕時。

sentences.english: There is nothing to fear or hide from local authorities.
sentences.chinese: 地方當局沒有什麼可懼怕或掩蓋的東西。

definition: to sense/to perceive/to become aware of/to detect
not knowing anything at all (idiom); completely ignorant/without an inkling
to worry about/to be concerned about
to turn a blind eye to/to ignore
